Instruction: Finely chop the Napa cabbage, green onions, garlic cloves, and ginger.

In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground pork, chopped cabbage, green onions, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, sesame oil, cornstarch, salt, and black pepper. Mix well until all ingredients are evenly incorporated.
Prepare a small bowl of water for sealing the dumplings.
To assemble the dumplings, place a small spoonful of the pork mixture in the center of a dumpling wrapper.
Dip your finger in the water and moisten the edge of the wrapper.
Fold the wrapper in half to form a half-moon shape, pressing the edges together to seal. You can pleat the edges for a decorative touch if desired.
Repeat the process with the remaining wrappers and pork mixture until all dumplings are assembled.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Once the oil is hot, carefully place the dumplings in the skillet, flat side down, in a single layer.
Cook the dumplings for 2-3 minutes, or until the bottoms are golden brown and crispy.
Pour water into the skillet, covering the dumplings halfway.
Cover the skillet with a lid and let the dumplings steam for 8-10 minutes, or until the water has evaporated and the dumplings are cooked through.
Remove the lid and let the dumplings cook for an additional 1-2 minutes to crisp up the bottoms.
Once cooked, transfer the dumplings to a serving plate.
Serve the pork dumplings hot with your favorite dipping sauce, such as soy sauce mixed with rice vinegar and chili oil.
